attributes.action: NATIONAL REGISTER FOR INTERPRETERS IN THE UK
attributes.additional_details:
I URGE THE MINUSTER OF JUSTICE TO EITHER DISSOLVE THE NATIONAL REGISTER FOR INTERPRETERS OR MAKE CHNAGES IN ORDER TO INTERPRETERS WHO PASSED THE ORAL EXAMINATION ONLY HAVE THE RIGHT TO JOIN IT AS CURRENTLY INTERPRETERS CAN INTERPRET IN COURT THANKS TO CHANGES MADE IN 2011 BUT THE NATIONAL REGISTER DOESN OT ACCEPT IT AND BEING AN INTERPRETER AND NOT A TRANSLATOR AND SOME PEOPLE CANNOT BE GOOD AT BOTH ORAL AND WIRTTEN IT IS NOT FAIR THAT INTERPRETES CANNOT JOIN IT ALTHOUGH THEY PASSED ALL THE ORAL TASKS. I URGE TO CREAT DIFFERENT TIERS TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER AS YOU CREATED SICNE 2011. OTHERSIWE TO DISSOLVE IT AS THE NATIONAL REGISTER HAS LITTLE IMPACT NOW .

OTHERWISE IF THE NATIONAL REGISTER WOULD STILL EXISTS I BELIEVE IS FAIR THAT ALL QUALIFIED INTERPRETERS JOIN  IT. OTHERWISE THE NAME WOULD BE NATIONAL REGISTER FOR INTERPRETERS AND TRANSLATORS WHICH IS NOT THE CASE.
